content: Cool, I’ll save this to read in a few days when I’ve actually taken the proper time to let the album sink in rather than react 10–15 hours post-release/leak. Now, I don’t mean that as a slight of any kind (though I disagree with the headline: I’m sure, since it’s Kendrick and that’s just how he seems to roll, he’ll rap harder on whatever he does next), I’m just always slightly confounded and exasperated by very quick reviews — in part because I am the type of fan that likes dissecting art over time and living with it as much as I can, in part because I’ve had to react journalistically way too quickly and with too little writing space way too many times. Doesn’t necessarily mean anything at all about the quality of the criticism and writing, it just rubs me the wrong way and is a systemic thing I foolishly wish modern journalism could rid itself of. EDIT: Huh, headline’s changed. Ah, well. Still though.
